question: aluminnati art installation and all our relations art features materials comparison aluminum glass
generated_answer: The Aluminnati art installation and All Our Relations art both feature aluminum as a primary material, but they differ in their use of glass. The Aluminnati, created by Jeff Welch, is a two-story aluminum relief map of the Ohio River basin, focusing on Cincinnati's center city. It does not incorporate glass into its design, relying solely on aluminum to create its topographical representation In contrast, All Our Relations art, as described in Document 3, is a glass and aluminum tile collection designed by Erin Adams. This artwork combines circles of colored glass nested in aluminum frames, highlighting the interplay between the two materials Thus, while both installations utilize aluminum, All Our Relations specifically integrates glass to create a unique visual and tactile experience, whereas the Aluminnati focuses exclusively on aluminum to depict geographical features.
ground_truth_answer: The Aluminnati and All Our Relations use different materials in their construction. The Aluminnati is made of over 1,200 individual pieces of plasma-cut aluminum, while All Our Relations features more than 8,000 hand-blown glass beads. Both are large-scale art installations - the Aluminnati measures 22 feet tall by 15 feet wide, while All Our Relations consists of five towering panels.
